intro: Gnaphalium filagopsis, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous stature and produces tiny, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Gnaphalium filagopsis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
